greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower prime of the second gap of 2n between primes.
reference: Enoch Haga, Exploring Prime Numbers on Your PC, 2nd edition, 1998, ISBN 1-885794-16-9, Table 4, pages 38-39.
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..210
formula: a(n) = A000230(n) + A046728(n). - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 26 2020
example: The second prime gap of 4 is at 13 to 17, so a(2)=13.
mathematica: tt[_] := -2; p0 = NextPrime@2; p1 = NextPrime@p0; While[p0 < 25000000, diff = (p1 - p0)/2; If[tt[diff] == -1, tt[diff] = p0]; If[tt[diff] == -2, tt[diff] = -1]; {p0, p1} = {p1, NextPrime@p1}]; tt@# & /@ Range@77 (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 26 2020 *)
results.author: _Jud McCranie_
